body: If it is any help the environment we are running is Centos 7.2 x64. Open SSL Version: 1.0.2j  26 Sep 2016

```
bash-4.2$ npm test

> grpc@1.1.0-dev test /path/to/source
> mocha src/node/test && npm run-script lint



  Async functionality
    ✓ should not hang

  call
    constructor
      ✓ should reject anything less than 3 arguments
      ✓ should succeed with a Channel, a string, and a date or number
      ✓ should accept an optional fourth string parameter
      ✓ should fail with a closed channel
      ✓ should fail with other types
      ✓ should succeed without the new keyword
    deadline
      ✓ should time out immediately with negative deadline
    startBatch
      ✓ should fail without an object and a function
      ✓ should succeed with an empty object
    startBatch with metadata
      ✓ should succeed with a map of strings to string arrays
      ✓ should succeed with a map of strings to buffer arrays
      ✓ should fail with other parameter types
    cancel
      ✓ should succeed
    cancelWithStatus
      ✓ should reject anything other than an integer and a string
      ✓ should reject the OK status code
      ✓ should result in the call ending with a status
    getPeer
      ✓ should return a string

  channel
    constructor
      ✓ should require a string for the first argument
      ✓ should require a credential for the second argument
      ✓ should accept an object for the third argument
      ✓ should only accept objects with string or int values
      ✓ should succeed without the new keyword
    close
      ✓ should succeed silently
      ✓ should be idempotent
    getTarget
      ✓ should return a string
    getConnectivityState
      ✓ should return IDLE for a new channel
    watchConnectivityState
      ✓ should time out if called alone (1001ms)
      ✓ should complete if a connection attempt is forced
      ✓ should complete twice if called twice

  Proto message long int serialize and deserialize
    ✓ should preserve positive int64 values
    ✓ should preserve negative int64 values
    ✓ should preserve uint64 values
    ✓ should preserve positive sint64 values
    ✓ should preserve negative sint64 values
    ✓ should preserve fixed64 values
    ✓ should preserve positive sfixed64 values
    ✓ should preserve negative sfixed64 values
    ✓ should deserialize as a number with the right option set

  Proto message bytes serialize and deserialize
    ✓ should preserve a buffer
    ✓ should accept base64 encoded strings
    ✓ should output base64 encoded strings with an option set
    - should serialize a repeated field as packed by default
    - should deserialize packed or unpacked repeated

  constants
    ✓ should have all of the status constants
    ✓ should have all of the call errors
    ✓ should have all of the propagate flags
    ✓ should have all of the connectivity states

  channel credentials
    #createSsl
      ✓ works with no arguments
      ✓ works with just one Buffer argument
      ✓ works with 3 Buffer arguments
      ✓ works if the first argument is null
      ✓ fails if the first argument is a non-Buffer value
      ✓ fails if the second argument is a non-Buffer value
      ✓ fails if the third argument is a non-Buffer value
      ✓ fails if only 1 of the last 2 arguments is provided

  server credentials
    #createSsl
      ✓ accepts a buffer and array as the first 2 arguments
      ✓ accepts a boolean as the third argument
      ✓ accepts an object with two buffers in the second argument
      ✓ accepts multiple objects in the second argument
      ✓ fails if the second argument is not an Array
      ✓ fails if the first argument is a non-Buffer value
      ✓ fails if the third argument is a non-boolean value
      ✓ fails if the array elements are not objects
      ✓ fails if the object does not have a Buffer private_key
      ✓ fails if the object does not have a Buffer cert_chain

  client credentials
/usr/bin/node: symbol lookup error: /home/apiproxy/grpcsource/src/node/extension_binary/grpc_node.node: undefined symbol: SSL_CTX_set_alpn_select_cb
npm ERR! Test failed.  See above for more details.
```

After compiling openssl to the latest version myself and trying to link it instead of the default installation i found out that it is literally not even linked properly in the .node file as shown below

```
bash-4.2$ ldd /path/to/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/grpc_node.node
        linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffc0e3c3000)
        libstdc++.so.6 => /lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f97f0e80000)
        libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007f97f0b7d000)
        libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f97f0967000)
        libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f97f074b000)
        libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007f97f0389000)
        /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f97f1462000)
```

Node gRPC doesn't link with SSL explicitly. Instead, it uses the SSL symbols that the Node binary exports. The specific error message you're seeing indicates that gRPC was compiled assuming that ALPN functionality is available in the SSL implementation that it's using.

What version of Node are you using?

I was trying to recompile node this morning with the SSL libs but I seem to be failing to do so. I was trying to use:

`./configure --shared-openssl --shared-openssl-includes=/usr/local/include/openssl --shared-openssl-libpath=/usr/local/lib64`

No luck though, kept getting compilation errors below:


So in the end i got this to work. Finally did manage to get it to all rebuild with ssl properly. Weird that it doesn't have a ssl reference in the ldd pastes though
